intro: Sarcolobus merrillii, commonly known as the Hainan mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Sarcolobus merrillii is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments within montane forests.
